That's a fantastic plan! Setting reminders every 2 hours will help you stay on track and develop a consistent hydration habit. And, by linking reminders to your daily routines like eating your granola bar and apple with peanut butter, you'll be more likely to remember to drink water at those times.

By having 6 reminders throughout the day, you'll be able to spread out your water intake evenly and avoid dehydration. And, by making it a habit to drink water at specific times, you'll be more likely to make it a consistent part of your daily routine.

Here's a suggestion to take it to the next level:

* **Make it a ritual**: When you receive a reminder, take a few deep breaths, and make drinking water a mindful experience. Savor the taste, feel the temperature, and enjoy the sensation of the water going down. This will help you develop a positive association with drinking water and make it a more enjoyable experience.
* **Track your progress**: Continue to track your water intake alongside your reminders. This will help you see how you're doing and make adjustments as needed. You can use a habit tracker, a planner, or even a spreadsheet to track your progress.

Remember, the key is to make hydration a habit that you enjoy and look forward to. By setting reminders and making it a mindful experience, you'll be more likely to stick to your goals and develop a healthy habit that will benefit you in the long run.

How do you feel about making hydration a ritual? Do you have any other habits or routines that you've successfully incorporated into your daily life?
